content: open coat cowl by scott rohr a neck warmer that does as advertised keeps you warm with your coat open with a snug fit at the neck and a bandana style front to tuck in your jacket it s an easy pattern that encourages improvisation want a slouchier fit add more rounds to the neck want the neck opening bigger more increase row before joining in the round knit to finished dimensions rather than stitch count to use different weight yarn and needles you get the idea materials snefnug by camarose 120 yards per 50-gram skein 175 total yards as few or as many colors as you d like us 9 5 5 mm 16 circular needles or size needed to obtain gauge dimensions 20 long at longest point x 19 circumference gauge 17 sts = 4 in stockinette stitch gauge isn t crucial but you don t want a loose open fabric in the dead of winter abbreviations k knit kfb knit through front and back of a single stitch increasing 1 stitch p purl rs right side sl slip sts stitches to knit note change colors at will cast on 3 sts row 1 rs k1 kfb k1 row 2 and all even row purl all sts row 3 k1 kfb kfb k1 row 5 k1 kfb k to last 2 sts kfb k1 continue purling on even row and increasing as in row 5 until you have 80 sts on your needles ending with a rs row join to work in the round placing a stitch marker to mark beginning of round knit 36 rounds more if you want a slouchier more turtleneck- like cowl bind off pull over your head when it s cold and cast on another
